Key Match Events: Harry Brook brought up his first WC fifty
Quinton de Kock added seven runs after being dropped
Buttler ran out Heinrich Klaasen with a GUN throw to the non-striker's end
De Kock's half-century off 22 balls equaled the fastest fifty of the tournament
Pre-Game Insights: England put South Africa in on a fresh pitch and anticipates some swing in humid, windy conditions
South Africa have shelved the experiment of two specialist spinners and brought back Ottneil Baartman for Tabraiz Shamsi
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa remain unbeaten at this T20 World Cup and are now 6/6!

Props have to go to Quinton de Kock, who set them up so well, and to Keshav Maharaj, for controlling the mid-section of the innings, to Anrich Nortje for bowling a good final over and to Aiden Markram for a second clutch catch in this tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England need more than 12 runs an over, more than two runs a ball, at this stage and they may start thinking about not losing too badly.
